com.guidewire.ab.external.entity

Interface ExchangeRate

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Editable, gw.pl.external.entity.Entity, gw.pl.external.entity.KeyableEntity, Retireable, Versionable
    Deprecated. 
    External entities are deprecated. Please use the new Java API instead.

    @Deprecated
public interface ExchangeRate
extends Retireable, gw.pl.external.entity.Entity
    A rate for converting one currency to another.

      • getNormalizedRate

        java.math.BigDecimal getNormalizedRate()
        Deprecated. 
        BaseUnits of BaseCurrency = NormalizedRate * 10^-RateScale * PriceUnits of PriceCurrency. NOTE: when inserting a ExchangeRate this field must be non-null.

      • getRate

        java.math.BigDecimal getRate()
        Deprecated. 
        The actual exchange rate, without any of the scaling that occurs internally. This should be the value presented to users.

      • setRate

        void setRate(java.math.BigDecimal value)
        Deprecated. 
        The actual exchange rate, without any of the scaling that occurs internally. This should be the value presented to users.

      • getRateScale

        java.lang.Integer getRateScale()
        Deprecated. 
        Amount by which NormalizedRate was scaled. ExchangeRates are stored as a normalized value plus a scale so that exact floating-point exchange rates can be stored in fixed-width database columnns.

      • setRateScale

        void setRateScale(java.lang.Integer value)
        Deprecated. 
        Amount by which NormalizedRate was scaled. ExchangeRates are stored as a normalized value plus a scale so that exact floating-point exchange rates can be stored in fixed-width database columnns.

      • setRate_Method

        void setRate_Method(java.math.BigDecimal value)
        Deprecated. 
        The actual exchange rate, without any scaling. Exchange rate values received from users should be passed to this method. Internally, a scale will be extracted from value, and the result and its scale will be stored in the NormalizedRate and RateScale properties. However, the original (unscaled) value can be retrieved from getRate()
        Parameters:
        value -
